result.execSummary:
The defendant Mildred Lee Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT:  Pay all court costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax inteercept or or other mean
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two.  Credit for 150 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No further violations of the law.
No violent contact with victim.  Do not use an implement or device for discipline.  No physical discipline.
No contact with firearms.

Participate in services at the Benedict Center.
Complete Batterers Intervention program, trauma based.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact order;  and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he  must provide a DNA sample, his voting rights are suspended and he may never possess firearms.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one. Credit for 150 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 5 YEARS 6 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Count 2; credit for 150 days served.  Court ordered 2 YEARS 6 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 3 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 3 YEARS 6 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Count 1; credit for 150 days served.  Court ordered 1 YEAR 6 MONTHS Initial Term Of Confinement and 2 YEARS Extended Supervision.

Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Earned Release Programs.
.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Participate in services at the Benedict Center.
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program (trauma based).
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No violent contact with victim; do not use an impement or device for discipline.  No physical discipline.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
JUDGE JEFFREY KREMERS FOR JUDGE REBECCA DALLET.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Habitual Criminality, dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Child Abuse, Recklessy Cause Bodily Harm, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing Information from Attorney Krause received and filed.  rmm

Attorney Bridget J. Krause in court, defendant Mildred Lee Mills not in court, in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Parties are still in negotiations.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Defense believes this matter is going to resolve, but would like to get a phychiatric evaluation done of the defendant.  At the request of the parties, the 6/25/14 jury trial is vacated.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget J Krause in court, defendant Mildred Lee Mills not in court, in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held off the record.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived the reading of the Amended Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty.  Based upon the amended complaint, Court reinstated the Repeater enhancer.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Absolutely no contact with any of the Defendant's children,
No unsupervised contact with any child under the age of 16,
Absolutely no babysitting or providing child care to any child.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Defendant Mildred Lee Mills in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defense moves to dimiss the repeater penalty enhancer. State moves to amend complaint. Court dismisses repeater penalty enhance in Count 1 and 2. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
